intro: Boesenbergia javanum, commonly known as the Javanese ginger or Java turmeric, is a rhizomatous herb native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Zingiberaceae family, which includes other aromatic plants like ginger and turmeric. The plant features long, narrow leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in inflorescences. Its rhizomes are often used in traditional medicine and as a spice due to their aromatic properties. The botanical characteristics of Boesenbergia javanum make it an important species in both horticulture and medicinal botany.
